title: Variable selection method for GLMMs — RandomRPQL-package
text: release version yet available. available CRAN running install.packages('RandomRPQL').  recent development version available GitHub running remotes::install_github('OuhscBbmc/RandomRPQL') (make sure remotes already installed). trouble package, please install development version.  solve problem, please create new issue, email .

title: Title — random_rpql
text: random_rpql() allows user variable selection fixed effect random effect GLMMs model using rpql(Hui,et al,2017) random lasso(Wang, et al., 2011)

title: Title — random_rpql
Title — random_rpql
text: data dataset without missing data q1_fix number fixed effects used bootstrapping step first step random rpql q1_random number random effects used bootstrapping step first step random rpql bt1 number bootstrapping first step random rpql fixed_effect candidate variables used fixed effects random_effect candidate variables used random effects ycol outcome variables id_vector column names groups (cross-sectional design)/participants id(longitudinal design) within-units id no_scale variable names discrete variables cluster_id variable name participants id/group id within_cluster_id variable name time/id participant within unit(participant/group) family distribution outcome GLMM.  Supported arguments include: gaussian(), binomial(). lam1 vector tuning parameters used rPQL bootstrapping step first step verbose show running details ci_criteria1 criteria choose optimal tuning parameters step 1, details refers Hui,et al,2017 pen.type1 type penalty used random rpql first step. supported argument include: "lasso" standard lasso(Tibshirani,1996),"adl"adaptive lasso(Zou,2006) random_draw_sample1 proportion sample used bootstrapping first step q2_fix number fixed effects used bootstrapping step second step random rpql q2_random number random effects used bootstrapping step second step random rpql bt2 number bootstrapping second step random rpql lam2 vector tuning parameters used rPQL bootstrapping step first step pen.type2 type penalty used random rpql second step ci_criteria2 criteria choose optimal tuning parameters step 2, details refers Hui,et al,2017 random_draw_sample2 proportion sample used bootstrapping second step use_lmer pen.type2 true, whether use lmer derived weights penalty. use_lmer=T, using lmer calculate weights "adl". otherwise, weights "adl" calculated importance index obtained first step use_fre_fun1 whether used frequency list calculate importance index

title: Title — random_rpql
text: variable importance plots tables fixed effects random effects

title: Title — random_rpql
Title — random_rpql
text: Hui, F. K. C., Mueller, S., Welsh, .H. (2017). Hierarchical Selection Fixed Random Effects Generalized Linear Mixed Models. Statistica Sinica, 27, 501-518. Wang, S., Nan, B., Rosset, S., & Zhu, J. (2011). Random lasso. annals applied statistics, 5(1), 468.

title: Title — random_rpql
code: # \dontrun{ id_vector<- c("participant_id", "wave")  no_scale <- c("participant_id", "wave") cluster_id="participant_id" within_cluster_id="wave" ycol <- "y" family<-"gaussian" lam1=exp(seq(from=log(1e-4),to=log(1e-8),length.out=100)) lam2=exp(seq(from=log(1e-1),to=log(1e-8),length.out=100))  random_rpql(data,q1_fix=4,q1_random=3,bt1=200,fixed_effect,random_effect,ycol,id_vector,no_scale,cluster_id,within_cluster_id,family="gaussian",lam1,verbose=T,ci_criteria1=5,pen.type1="adl",random_draw_sample1=0.5,q2_fix=4,q2_random=3,bt2=200,lam2,pen.type2="adl",ci_criteria2=4,random_draw_sample2=0.5,use_lmer=F,use_fre_fun1=T) #> Error in UseMethod("select"): no applicable method for 'select' applied to an object of class "function"  # }
